page.title: 16Dowlais Stables.
page.content: The Dowlais Stables were built in 1820.It is a large stone building with a big arch in the middle and a clock and tower on the top.It was built to house the many horses that worked in the world famous Dowlais Ironworks. There was a cottage inside the stables which was once used as a school for the children of the ironworkers.Our teacher told us that many boys of 8 or 9 would have worked in the stables as stable lads.They would have fed, watered,exercised the horses as well as cleaning the stables.They worked very hard and were paid very poor wages. I think I would have enjoyed feeding and exercising the horses but I'm not sure about cleaning after them At the moment the front of the stables are being repaired because it is very old and has began to fall down.It will look very nice when it is finished.
